176.title: Guj Cong leader among 345 infected with food poisoning after event
176.article_body: Over 345 people, including Gujarat Congress leader Suleman Patel, were infected with food poisoning after attending a religious gathering in Bharuch on Sunday. The Congress leader was discharged on Monday, while two children are currently undergoing treatment. People complained of vomiting, diarrhoea and stomach ache after having food at the event.

177.title: Ankush Saigal appointed as Wipro's Telecom Head for Southeast Asia
177.article_body: Wipro has announced Ankush Saigal as its telecom industry sector head in Southeast Asia to lead the company's business growth for the region. Prior to joining Wipro, Saigal worked with Accenture, expanding technology sales across industry, driving go-to-market with key ecosystem partners and managing client relationships. Saigal has also worked with Infosys, managing business relationships.

178.title: Attached clips to hip to recreate gunshot pain for 'Lootera': Ranveer
178.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed that he tried to recreate a gunshot-level pain for his 2013 film 'Lootera'. "I used to take these very industrial-grade clips and clip them to my hip in the morning," he stated. "When they said, roll camera, I'd hit it...[the] pain would go from the tip of my toe to my hip," the actor added.

179.title: India have a chance to win hockey WC 2023: Ex-Olympic medallist
179.article_body: Ex-Olympic silver medallist Juan Escarre said that India have a chance to win the FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023 in Bhubaneswar. "Belgium, Australia and you will always find a very good German team...And, the Netherlands and Spain as well. But, you never know, anything is possible in this kind of tournament," Escarre said.

180.title: K'taka BJP leader arrested over threat to Mallikarjun Kharge's son
180.article_body: Karnataka BJP leader Manikanth Rathod was on Sunday arrested for issuing a death threat to Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge's son and MLA Priyank Kharge. However, he was released on bail later. Rathod had threatened Priyank Kharge after he lashed out at BJP workers over a campaign against him in Chittapur on November 8.

181.title: Congress workers vandalise party office over candidate selection for Guj polls
181.article_body: Congress workers from Jamalpur-Khadia and Vatva in Ahmedabad vandalised the party headquarters to protest against candidate selection for Gujarat Assembly polls. Protestors alleged that MLA Imran Khedawala, Congress' candidate for Jamalpur-Khadia seat, is connected with local real-estate lobby and will lose the polls. A video of the incident showed workers defacing walls and writing slogans.

182.title: 12 labourers feared trapped after stone quarry collapses in Mizoram
182.article_body: At least a dozen labourers from Bihar are feared trapped after a stone quarry collapsed in Mizoram on Monday. As per reports, the incident took place when the labourers, who were working in the area, had returned from their lunch break. State Disaster Response Force, Border Security Force (BSF) and Assam Rifles have been deployed to assist in rescue operations.

183.title: Shaheen's injury not a factor, Pak was 15-20 runs short: Gavaskar
183.article_body: Ex-Indian skipper Sunil Gavaskar said that he doesn't think that pacer Shaheen Afridi's injury in the middle of the T20 World Cup final cost Pakistan the match. "Pakistan were around 15-20 runs short...I don't think the 10 deliveries that Shaheen didn't bowl would have made...difference. Maybe Pakistan would have got another wicket, but England would still have won," Gavaskar said.

184.title: Iran strikes Kurdish outfit's HQ in Iraq; 2 killed, 10 injured
184.article_body: Two people were killed and 10 were injured on Monday after an Iranian Kurdish party's headquarters in Iraq's Koye city was hit by rockets and drones, officials said. Iranian state media said the country's Revolutionary Guards had attacked the bases of "terrorist groups" in Iraq's autonomous Kurdish region. Tehran blames Iraq-based Iranian Kurdish groups for the ongoing unrest in Iran.

185.title: Sharath Kamal Achanta to be conferred with Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award 2022
185.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal Achanta will be conferred with Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award 2022. He will receive the award from President Droupadi Murmu on November 30 in a ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan. Sharath Kamal bagged three gold medals at Commonwealth Games in Birmingham earlier this year.

186.title: Narrated 'Salaam Venky' to Aamir Khan, he said 'Won't change a word': Director
186.article_body: Filmmaker Revathy opened up about how actor Aamir Khan agreed to be a part of her upcoming film 'Salaam Venky', which also features Kajol. She stated, "Aamir said he just wanted to read his scenes...It was just over the phone. Then we had a film narration...Aamir said, 'I won't change a single word, I'll just do the film'."

187.title: Musk scolds Android engineer on Twitter, asks 'What have you done to fix the app?'
187.article_body: Elon Musk publicly scolded Twitter app's Android engineer Eric Frohnhoefer and tweeted, "Twitter is super slow on Android. What have you done to fix that?" Musk tweeted this after Eric contended Musk's claim of Twitter being "super slow" in many countries. "I have spent 6 years working on Twitter for Android and can say this is wrong," Eric had said.

188.title: US Prez opposes China's 'aggressive acts' on Taiwan in 1st meet with Chinese Prez
188.article_body: US President Joe Biden met with Chinese President Xi Jinping for the first time since assuming office amid tensions over Taiwan. The meeting took place on the sidelines of the G20 Summit in Indonesia's Bali and Biden raised concerns about China's human rights record, the White House said. He also objected to China's "coercive and increasingly aggressive actions toward Taiwan".

189.title: Pakistan fought valiantly vs England in T20 WC 2022 final: Bangar
189.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said Pakistan fought "valiantly" in the T20 World Cup 2022 final as having a score of 137 was never going to be enough against the lineup that England possessed. Put to bat first, Pakistan managed to score 137/8 in 20 overs. England chased the target in 19 overs. They won by five wickets.

190.title: Electric mobility startup Yulu raises $9 mn via debt-financing
190.article_body: Electric mobility startup Yulu raised $9 million in funding from US International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) through debt-financing. The Bengaluru-based firm was founded in 2017 by RK Misra, Naveen Dachuri, Hemant Gupta and Amit Gupta and provides urban mobility supported by AI-powered battery. In September, Yulu raised $82 million in a funding round led by Canada's Magna International.

191.title: Ex-Army man run over by truck while trying to avoid pothole in K'taka
191.article_body: A retired Indian Army soldier, on a two-wheeler, was killed after he was run over by a truck while trying to avoid a pothole in Karnataka's Mandya district. Police said the truck was seized following the accident and a case was lodged. Former CM and Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy criticised the state government over poor condition of roads.

192.title: Zomato to shut down UAE app on November 24
192.article_body: Zomato announced that it will discontinue its application in the United Arab Emirates on November 24, according to a regulatory filing. Customers looking to order food through the Zomato app in UAE will be redirected to Talabat, the filing added. Zomato sold its UAE food delivery business to Talabat in 2019 for $172 million.

193.title: SEBI proposes mandating top 250 listed firms to confirm or deny media reports
193.article_body: SEBI has proposed mandating the top 250 listed companies to confirm or deny any information reported in the mainstream media, which may have a material effect on the listed entity, to streamline the disclosure requirements. SEBI has also suggested reducing the timeline to 12 hours from the occurrence of events or information for making disclosure to the stock exchanges.

194.title: Wife, brother arrested for murdering 35-year-old man in Ghaziabad
194.article_body: A day after a 35-year-old man was found murdered at his house in Ghaziabad's Loni, the local police arrested his wife and the victim's younger brother for the alleged murder. The accused, Sazra Khatoon (32) and Mohammad Amir (21), allegedly murdered the victim, Ayaz Ahmad, as they were in a relationship which was objected by the victim, police said.

195.title: 35-yr-old man, 5 dogs electrocuted to death near farm in Tamil Nadu
195.article_body: A 35-year-old man and five of his dogs were electrocuted to death when they came in contact with an illegal electric fence near a farm in Tamil Nadu's Madurai district. According to police, the deceased and two of his friends had gone hunting for hares on Saturday night when the incident took place.

196.title: Zomato Head of New Businesses Rahul Ganjoo resigns
196.article_body: Zomato's Head of New Businesses Rahul Ganjoo has resigned from the company after five years, according to a regulatory filing. He joined Zomato in 2017 as the head of product development and assumed the title of Head of New Businesses in August this year. Zomato reported a consolidated net loss of ₹250.8 crore in the quarter ended September.

197.title: Delhi restaurants allowed to serve food in open spaces, terraces
197.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has eased licencing norms for restaurants to use open spaces and terraces for serving food. According to an official document, eateries following certain restrictions will not require an additional fire no-objection certificate (NOC) for using such spaces. No cooking or preparation of eatables is allowed in any part of the open space or terrace.

198.title: Drunk driver rams car onto footpath in Pune, 3 people injured
198.article_body: A real estate dealer who was driving under the influence of alcohol rammed his car onto a footpath in Pune's Wakad area. The driver of the car, Harsh Mohan Singh, hit three people who were walking back home. One of the injured was dragged for a certain distance by the car and sustained head injuries. The police have booked Singh.

199.title: Relationship with SRK, Anil Kapoor has not changed: Subhash Ghai
199.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai has said that his relationship with Shah Rukh Khan and Anil Kapoor has not changed. He further added that Jackie Shroff, Sanjay Dutt, Madhuri Dixit and Mahima Chaudhry are still his friends and they still meet. "I went to Anil's house the day before yesterday. We drank and shared our experience," Subhash further stated.

200.title: 62 migrants rescued from sailboat in Aegean Sea: Greek Coast Guard
200.article_body: A cargo ship rescued 62 migrants from a sailboat taking on water in the eastern Aegean Sea, the Greek Coast Guard said. The survivors were later transferred to a coast guard lifeboat. The coast guard said it had launched a search and rescue operation following a distress call in the early hours of Monday about a vessel in rough seas.

201.title: If you want to become heroes, lift 2023 WC title at Wankhede: Akhtar to Pak
201.article_body: Motivating Pakistan after their five-wicket loss in T20 World Cup 2022 final, Shoaib Akhtar said, "If you want to become heroes, lift the World Cup [2023] trophy at Wankhede Stadium. This is a challenge for you. Go and get fit." Akhtar praised Pakistan, saying, "Well done Pakistan...Playing the World Cup final is not a small achievement."

202.title: SC refuses to stay proceedings in Delhi riots case against Tahir Hussain
202.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to stay proceedings against former AAP Councillor Tahir Hussain over cases registered against him for the 2020 northeast Delhi riots. The bench said it is not inclined to interfere with the Delhi High Court's September 16 interim order and all remedies are open to the petitioner. Hussain has been in judicial custody since March 16, 2020.

203.title: Mumbai gym trainer molests woman, threatens to kidnap her daughter
203.article_body: A 29-year-old gym trainer was arrested for molesting a woman and threatening to kidnap her daughter if she refused to meet him, reports said. The victim said that the accused took her number to place orders for vada pav, on which he called multiple times. Denying such claims, the accused's lawyer said that the two shared pictures on social media.

204.title: Mumbai student aims to make city police stations more eco-friendly
204.article_body: Joint Commissioner (Law and Order) of Mumbai Police, Vishwas Nangre Patil, recently interacted with a young student who had put together a presentation on how to make police stations more environment-friendly. The student's plan included the introduction of air-purifying local plants and making stations plastic-free. His plans included having a more sophisticated water and waste management system.

205.title: Hyd boy asks KTR for municipal water on Children's Day, he responds
205.article_body: In a video that has now gone viral, a boy from Hyderabad asked Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao (KTR) for municipal water on Children's Day. KTR responded to the video and asked Dana Kishore, Managing Director, Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB), to visit the place and resolve the issue. "Yes sir. Will inspect," Kishore responded.

206.title: Actor Sunil Shende passes away at 75
206.article_body: Actor Sunil Shende, who appeared in shows and movies like 'Circus', 'Shanti' and 'Sarfarosh', passed away at 75 at his Mumbai residence on Monday. The cause of death of Shende, who appeared in movies such as 'Gandhi', 'Ghayaal', 'Ziddi', 'Daud', and 'Viruddh', was not immediately known. "Great actor and a great human being," his 'Shanti' co-star Rajesh Tailang tweeted.

207.title: New portrait of King Charles released to celebrate his first birthday as monarch
207.article_body: A portrait has been released to mark the birthday of King Charles, who turned 74 today. The image shows him leaning against an ancient oak tree in Windsor. Buckingham Palace announced he's taking on role of The Ranger of Windsor Great Park, a post previously held by his father, Prince Philip. This is King Charles' first birthday since becoming monarch.

208.title: Neither of us has felt it: Arbaaz on 22-yr age gap with girlfriend Giorgia
208.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan in an interview addressed the 22-year age gap between him and his girlfriend-model Giorgia Andriani. "There's a humongous age difference between us, but neither of us has felt it," he said. Arbaaz further said that Giorgia is a wonderful girl, adding, "She has that...exuberance in her, that energy in her...I draw energy from her sometimes."

209.title: IAS officer Gaurav Dwivedi appointed new CEO of Prasar Bharati
209.article_body: Senior IAS officer Gaurav Dwivedi has been appointed the CEO of state broadcaster Prasar Bharati. He will serve in the office for a period of five years, the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting said in a statement on Monday. He is currently posted as Chief Executive Officer, MyGov, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

210.title: US' Paralympic gold medal-winning swimmer Griswold accused of raping teammate
210.article_body: US' Paralympic gold medal-winning swimmer Robert Griswold, 25, has been accused of raping and abusing his 19-year-old teammate Parker Egbert. As per a lawsuit, Griswold allegedly "maliciously targeted" Parker during Tokyo Paralympics last year and at the US Olympic & Paralympic Training Center in Colorado. "This case is a horrific tragedy," the lawsuit further stated.

211.title: I'll donate majority of my $124 bn wealth: World's 4th richest man Jeff Bezos
211.article_body: Amazon Founder and the world's fourth-richest person Jeff Bezos has said that he will donate the majority of his $124 billion wealth in his lifetime. "The hard part is figuring out how to do it in a levered way," Bezos said. "It's not easy...There are a bunch of ways that I think you could do ineffective things, too," he added.

212.title: Major highways closed, villages cut off after snowfall, rain in J&K
212.article_body: Major highways were closed and villages in high-altitude areas were cut off due to heavy overnight snowfall and rains in Jammu and Kashmir. As a precautionary measure, authorities closed schools in some districts on Monday. According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the minimum temperature in the valley can reach up to minus 3 degree Celsius on Monday.

213.title: DCW chief issues notice to Delhi Police over Shraddha murder case
213.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal has issued a notice to the Delhi Police and taken "suo-moto cognizance" of the murder of a woman, Shraddha, in Mehrauli. The notice directs police to provide various information and documents, including a copy of the FIR registered in the case and details of the action taken report in the matter.

214.title: Delhi bus driver suffers epileptic fit, rams bus into auto; 1 killed
214.article_body: A 49-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was killed after a bus rammed into his vehicle in Delhi's Civil Lines. The incident took place on Sunday morning when a 37-year-old bus driver suffered an epileptic fit and lost control of the vehicle. The accused has been arrested and booked for rash driving and causing death by negligence.

215.title: I'm sorry: CM Mamata after Bengal minister says 'how does our President look?'
215.article_body: Reacting to West Bengal minister Akhil Giri's remarks on President Droupadi Murmu, CM Mamata Banerjee said, "I am sorry, I do apologise on behalf of the party (Trinamool Congress)." Giri courted controversy by saying, "We don't judge anyone by their appearance...but how does our President look?" Mamata condemned his remark, saying, "Beauty can't be decided by external looks."

216.title: It's a myth when people say eat for two during pregnancy: Sonam
216.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, who welcomed a baby boy on August 20, opened up about her diet which she followed during her pregnancy days. She stated that "it's a myth when people say eat for two". "Please be sensible while eating if you are carrying a single baby. You need only 350 calories more," Sonam added.

217.title: Jawaharlal Nehru didn't act in 'desh hith' on Kashmir issue: Rijiju
217.article_body: India's first PM, Jawaharlal Nehru, didn't act in "desh hith" (country's interests) when it came to Kashmir, said Minister of Law and Justice Kiren Rijiju. "There was no question of plebiscite or taking views of people or any other organisations. Why did Nehru ji make a departure for Kashmir?" he asked, adding that Hari Singh's views were not accepted.

218.title: Mumbai's air quality drops to 'poor' category, AQI rises to 221
218.article_body: Mumbai's air quality slipped from 'moderate' to 'poor' quality on Monday, with the AQI rising to 221, as per the data released by the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research (SAFAR). The overall AQI was 152 (moderate) on Saturday and it was 159 (moderate) on Sunday. Areas, including Andheri and Malad, too reported 'poor' AQI.

219.title: We need intimacy coordinators, people do get exploited: Radhika Apte
219.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has said that she never had an intimacy coordinator, however, added that they "absolutely need it". "People do get exploited...people who exploit, don't necessarily do it with the intention either," she stated. Radhika recalled an instance when she agreed to do something after coming under pressure, however, her agents said, "This is not okay."

220.title: 'Brahmastra 2' will be juicier & more clash oriented: Ayan Mukerji
220.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has said that 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev' will be "a lot more dramatic and juicier and a lot more clash oriented" than the first film. "I think that part two will just be more of everything, you know, more scale, more VFX, more Astras, more drama modules," Ayan added. 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' featured Ranbir Kapoor.

221.title: Crypto.com sends Ethereum worth $400 mn to another exchange by accident
221.article_body: Crypto.com CEO Kris Marszalek said that the company mistakenly sent over $400 million in Ethereum to another crypto exchange called Gate.io. He said, "It was supposed to be a move to a new cold storage address, but was sent to a whitelisted external exchange address. We worked with Gate team and the funds were subsequently returned to our cold storage."

222.title: Forced religious conversion a serious issue, may affect national security: SC
222.article_body: Forced religious conversion is a "very serious issue" and a "very difficult situation" will emerge if such conversions are not stopped, the Supreme Court observed on Monday. Religious conversions may ultimately affect the security of the nation and the freedom of religion and conscience of citizens, it added. It asked the Centre to make its stand clear on the issue.

223.title: Zelenskyy visits Kherson following the city's recapture from Russia
223.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday visited the southern city of Kherson following its recapture from Russian forces last week. Ukrainians, with their national flags, gathered in front of the administration building in the city's main square where Zelenskyy addressed his troops. He also thanked NATO and other allies for aiding Ukraine in ramping up its war efforts against Russia.

224.title: India need separate teams for different formats of cricket: Kumble
224.article_body: Former Indian skipper Anil Kumble said that India need separate teams for different formats of cricket. "You need, certainly, T20 specialists. I think what this English team...and...Australia have shown is that you need to invest in a lot of allrounders," Kumble said. He added, "No other team [apart from England] has a No. 7 of the quality of Liam Livingstone."

225.title: India's retail inflation declines to a 3-month low of 6.77% in October
225.article_body: India's retail inflation rate fell to a three-month low of 6.77% in October from 7.41% in September, data released by the government showed on Monday. Inflation in rural areas in October 2022 cooled to 6.98%, while that in urban areas softened to 6.50%. Meanwhile, wholesale inflation dipped to 8.39% in October, the lowest since March 2021.

226.title: EU agrees on introducing new sanctions over Iran's protest crackdown
226.article_body: All 27 foreign ministers of EU member states on Monday agreed on the introduction of a new sanctions regime against Iran for its allegedly violent clampdown on the ongoing anti-government protests in the country. The sanctions will target 32 individuals and organisations, including the "inner circle" of the Revolutionary Guard, responsible for the crackdown that has reportedly left hundreds dead.

227.title: 4 men hang dog with chain in Ghaziabad, booked after video surfaces
227.article_body: The Ghaziabad Police booked four men for allegedly hanging their pet dog with a chain after a purported video of the incident went viral. The accused can be seen hanging the dog with a chain and pulling a rope tied to its neck in the video. "Strict legal action will be taken against the accused," said Iraj Raja, SP (rural).

228.title: Man who chopped his live-in partner's body into 35 pieces in Delhi sent to 5-day custody
228.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday sent Aftab Ameen Poonawalla to five-day police custody for murdering his 26-year-old live-in partner Shraddha. The accused allegedly chopped her body into 35 pieces and dumped them at different locations in Delhi. Shraddha had met Aftab through a dating app when she was working at a call centre in Mumbai, police said.

229.title: 2018 champion PV Sindhu pulls out of BWF World Tour Finals
229.article_body: Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu has withdrawn from the season-ending BWF World Tour Finals as she has not fully recovered from a stress fracture on her left ankle. The tournament is scheduled to begin on December 14 in Guangzhou, China. The 2018 champion had sustained the injury en route to her gold medal win at Commonwealth Games in August.

230.title: Filmmaker Guneet Monga to tie the knot with entrepreneur Sunny Kapoor in Dec
230.article_body: Filmmaker Guneet Monga is all set to tie the knot with fashion entrepreneur Sunny Kapoor. The couple will get married in Mumbai on December 11 and 12, which will be followed by extended functions in Delhi on December 16. Guneet, who has produced films like 'Gangs of Wasseypur', 'The Lunchbox' and 'Masaan', got engaged to Sunny in April.

231.title: Vir Das postpones shows in Nov, says got ‘huge acting opportunity’
231.article_body: Comedian-actor Vir Das announced that he's postponing his November shows as he's "gotten a huge acting opportunity". "You'll see me on screen like you've never seen me before," he shared on Twitter. The announcement has come after his shows in Hyderabad and Bengaluru got cancelled amid protests by right-wing organisations, who accused him of making 'anti-India' comments.

232.title: Hrithik Roshan to begin shooting for 'Fighter' in Assam on Nov 18: Report
232.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan will reportedly begin shooting for his upcoming film 'Fighter' in Assam on November 18. "The leading man will be joined by co-stars Deepika Padukone and Anil Kapoor directly at the air force station that has been chosen as the site of the shoot," a source close to the development stated. 'Fighter' will be directed by Siddharth Anand.

233.title: 7 yrs after woman's suicide, Delhi court convicts in-laws for dowry death
233.article_body: A Delhi court convicted the parents-in-law and the husband of a woman, who died by suicide within 23 days of marriage in 2015, of causing her death for dowry and subjecting her to cruelty. The deceased's elder sister was a crucial witness to whom she revealed the conduct of the accused and how she was subjected to harassment and cruelty.

234.title: 3 govt officials dead after vehicle plunges into gorge in J&K’s Doda
234.article_body: Three government officials died while one other was critically injured in J&K’s Doda when their vehicle skidded off a road and plunged into a deep gorge on Monday, police said. LG Manoj Sinha expressed grief over the accident and directed the district administration to provide all possible assistance to the injured. The vehicle rolled down 200 meters into the gorge.

235.title: Top seed Nadal loses to Fritz, Ruud beats Auger-Aliassime at ATP Finals
235.article_body: Eighth-seeded Taylor Fritz defeated top-seeded Rafael Nadal 7-6(7-3), 6-1 in round-robin stage to make a winning debut at ATP Finals in Turin on Sunday. Earlier, Norway's Casper Ruud beat Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime 7-6(7-4), 6-4 in his first match of Green Group. Notably, Nadal has never won the ATP Finals title in 10 attempts. He finished runner-up in 2010 and 2013.

236.title: Sensitive info on excise policy leaked: AAP leader tells Delhi HC
236.article_body: AAP's communication in-charge, Vijay Nair, has approached the Delhi HC, alleging that sensitive information pertaining to the excise policy case is being leaked to the media by probe agencies. The HC has asked both CBI and ED to share press communication documents, which have been officially released. ED took Nair into custody on Monday.

237.title: Fintech startup Lentra raises $60 million in Series B round
237.article_body: Fintech cloud lending startup Lentra has raised $60 million in its Series B funding round led by existing investors Bessemer Venture Partners and SIG Venture Capital. The round also saw participation from Citi Ventures. Founded in 2018 by D Venkatesh and Ankur Handa, Lentra offers third-party API connectors to various data sources that banks want to join.

238.title: Dream big, dream for new and developed India: President Droupadi Murmu
238.article_body: Speaking to students at the Rashtrapati Bhavan on Children's Day, President Droupadi Murmu asked all the children to dream big and dream for a new and developed India. "This is a new era of technological and information revolution. Children are now aware about various domestic, social and environmental issues....knowledge and information are now at their fingertips," said Murmu.

239.title: Port Blair-based businessman held in Haryana in gang rape case
239.article_body: A Port Blair-based businessman, carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh, was arrested by Andaman and Nicobar Police from Haryana in connection with a gang rape case, an officer said. "Police got tip-off...through his bank transactions which he made from Haryana. Andaman and Nicobar Police alerted its Haryana and Delhi counterparts and managed to arrest him," the officer stated.

240.title: Tata starts process to bring all airlines under Air India: Report
240.article_body: Tata Sons has reportedly started the process to bring all its airlines, Vistara, AirAsia India and Air India Express, under Air India. Tata Sons has started this process after holding several rounds of discussions with Singapore Airlines, its joint venture partner in Vistara. Through this consolidation, Tata Sons will have a low-cost carrier and a full-service airline under Air India.

241.title: Jet Airways postpones assets' sale due to impasse over resolution plan: Report
241.article_body: Jet Airways has reportedly postponed its plan to monetise its assets due to a deadlock between the Jalan-Kalrock consortium and the lenders over the outline of its resolution plan. The assets include 11 aircraft and aircraft engine spares. NCLAT had ordered the Jalan-Kalrock consortium to pay ₹275 crore as the unpaid provident fund and gratuity dues of eligible employees.

242.title: Piramal, Bain-backed IndiaRF acquire majority stake in Impresario
242.article_body: India Resurgence Fund (IndiaRF), an investment platform backed by Piramal Enterprises and Bain Capital, announced investing ₹550 crore in food and beverage firm Impresario Entertainment and Hospitality. With the transaction, IndiaRF has become the majority shareholder of Impresario. According to an official release, the fresh capital will help fuel the further expansion of Impresario's business.

243.title: Tihar Jail Superintendent suspended over VIP treatment to Satyendar Jain
243.article_body: Tihar Jail Superintendent Ajit Kumar was suspended on Monday over alleged VIP treatment given to AAP minister Satyendar Jain. "He has prima facie been found to have committed irregularities that warrant an inquiry," the Prison Department of the Delhi government said. Earlier, ED claimed that Jain abused his power in jail and was provided with freshly cut fruits and massage.

244.title: Cricket Australia name their Team of T20 World Cup 2022
244.article_body: Cricket Australia have named their Team of T20 World Cup 2022, which comprises three England players, two Pakistan players, two India players and one player each from Bangladesh, New Zealand, South Africa and Zimbabwe. Jos Buttler has been included as captain, wicketkeeper and opener. The team also includes Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Mustafizur Rahman, Sikandar Raza and Anrich Nortje.

245.title: 3 dead after student opens fire at University of Virginia in US
245.article_body: Three people were killed and two were injured in a shooting at the University of Virginia, the university's President Jim Ryan said. A search operation has been launched to nab the suspect, identified as Christopher Darnell Jones, the police department said. Ryan added the suspect is a student and was seen wearing a burgundy jacket, blue jeans and red shoes.

246.title: We were ready to give up 'Chak De!' because of pressure: Salim-Sulaiman
246.article_body: Music composers Salim Merchant and Sulaiman Merchant shared their experience of composing music for 'Chak De! India'. While Salim said that the pressure to compose its music was "crazy", Sulaiman added they were "ready to give up the film" as they were "unable to crack title song". Salim said they took reference from 'Jumma Chumma...' to create the title track.

247.title: Congress becomes unhappy at the sight of saffron: K'taka CM Bommai
247.article_body: After Congress objected to the Karnataka government’s decision to paint classrooms in saffron, CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the Opposition party becomes unhappy at the sight of saffron. "The new classrooms are named after Swami Vivekananda, who was a monk. Hence, the architect suggested saffron...it doesn't have any political intentions," said Bommai.

248.title: Govt unblocks VLC Media Player website within a month of being served legal notice
248.article_body: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has unblocked VLC Media Player website within a month of being served a legal notice. In the notice, VideoLAN had demanded a copy of the blocking order and an opportunity to defend its case through virtual hearing. No explanation was reportedly provided by the government with regard to why the URL was blocked.

249.title: Aftab ordered food after killing Shraddha, was 'inspired' by US show 'Dexter'
249.article_body: Aftab Poonawalla, who allegedly killed his live-in partner Shraddha in Delhi, stayed in the house where the murder was committed to avoid suspicion, police said. He ordered food online after the murder and was "inspired" by the American crime drama 'Dexter', investigators added. Aftab hid Shraddha's dismembered corpse in a fridge and lit incense sticks (agarbattis) to hide the stench.

250.title: She wants to follow path of PM Modi: Jadeja on wife's candidature
250.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja, during a BJP event in Gujarat, said that his wife Rivaba Jadeja is first time contesting as an MLA candidate and she'll learn a lot. "I hope she will progress…She..has always wanted to help people and hence joined politics. She wants to follow the path of PM Modi to work for the people," Jadeja added.

251.title: 4 extort money from youngsters on gay dating app in Delhi; arrested
251.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested four men, who allegedly extorted money from youngsters on a gay dating app by threatening to post their intimate videos on social media. A 20-year-old, in his complaint, said that one of the accused took him to a room and the other accused started making a video when he got undressed, said DCP (Shahdara) R Sathiyasundaram.

252.title: 'Black...' collects ₹50 cr in India on opening weekend, 'Uunchai' earns ₹10 cr
252.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' has earned over ₹50 crore in India within three days of its release. Meanwhile, Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai' earned over ₹10 crore on the opening weekend at the domestic box office. 'Uunchai', which was released on limited screens, stars Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher, Boman Irani and Neena Gupta, among others.

253.title: Suniel Shetty to join Anurag Kashyap-starrer 'File No 323': Report
253.article_body: Suniel Shetty has reportedly joined 'File No 323' and will play Vijay Mallya's Chartered Accountant in the Karthik K directorial. The film will feature Anurag Kashyap as Vijay Mallya. "The team will also focus on the economic offences done by Mehul Choksi and Nirav Modi," a source told Pinkvilla. Reportedly, Suniel will join the film's shooting from November 21 onwards.

254.title: Hong Kong protest song replaces China anthem at rugby match in S Korea
254.article_body: A song embraced by Hong Kong pro-democracy protesters was played instead of China's national anthem before the final match, between South Korea and Hong Kong, of the Asia Rugby Sevens Series's second leg on Sunday. On Monday, the tournament's South Korean organisers apologised and said the wrong song was played because of a human error and was not politically motivated.

255.title: 9 including POCSO Act survivors go missing from Kerala shelter home
255.article_body: Nine inmates, including POCSO Act survivors, have gone missing from a shelter home in Kerala on Monday, police said. "The girls were protesting for...past few days saying they wanted to leave...shelter home," a senior police official said. The inmates were provided accommodation at the shelter home, which is run by a private NGO, upon the CWC's direction, police added.

256.title: Some sit in Bengal and tell Delhi not to give money to our state: Mamata
256.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that some people are sitting and eating in Bengal and conspiring and telling Delhi not to give money to Bengal. "I don't need Delhi's money. Bengal is capable of standing on its own feet. Our self-esteem is of utmost importance to us, we wouldn't let Delhi snatch it," she added.

257.title: Retired Army man shoots at woman, then kills self in Haryana
257.article_body: A retired Army man allegedly shot at a woman and then died by suicide in Haryana's Rohtak on Sunday, police said. The man and woman were known to each other and used to stay in the same colony, according to police. The SHO said that both of their families are being contacted and added, "We're probing why...man reached...woman's house."

258.title: Still confident that this group can lift WC: Hayden to Pak after T20 WC loss
258.article_body: Following Pakistan's loss against England in T20 World Cup 2022 final, Pakistan team mentor Matthew Hayden said he's confident that "this group of young men can lift the World Cup". He added, "And I'm confident that we also have some clarity on how to move forward from this tournament. How to celebrate some great performances and...acknowledge some of the weaknesses."

259.title: UP government issues advisory for school students amid dengue outbreak
259.article_body: As dengue cases are on the rise in UP, the government issued an advisory to all schools, instructing them to ensure that all the students wear full sleeve shirts and trousers. It also asked them to avoid keeping clutter on the school's premises. Earlier, the government had cancelled the leaves of all doctors and paramedical staff.

260.title: Sonia pays floral tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru on birth anniversary
260.article_body: Congress leader Sonia Gandhi and party President Mallikarjun Kharge paid a floral tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru in Delhi on Monday, on the occasion of the former PM's birth anniversary. Kharge called India's first PM the "maker of modern India". "He was a humanist-secularist who sought national development on all fronts, including agriculture and science," Congress said in a tweet.

261.title: Video shows firing on street near Mumbai amid fight between 2 groups
261.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing firing on a street in Ambarnath near Mumbai amid a fight between two groups. "There was a bullock cart race organised on Sunday morning between two groups. By evening the two groups indulged in some fight which was followed by open firing," police said. Though no one was injured, a car's windshield was damaged.

262.title: Aamir to have cameo in 'Salaam Venky', reunites with Kajol after 16 yrs
262.article_body: The trailer of 'Salaam Venky' showed a glimpse of Aamir Khan hinting at his cameo appearance in the film, which stars Kajol in the lead role. The film will mark Kajol and Aamir's first on-screen appearance in 16 years after their film 'Fanaa', which released in 2006. 'Salaam Venky', which was previously titled 'The Last Hurrah', is directed by Revathy.

263.title: Bomb threat forces London-bound flight to land in Germany
263.article_body: A passenger plane en route to London carrying 206 people was forced to land in the western German city of Paderborn on Sunday night following a bomb threat. No suspicious objects were found during the search of the Airbus A321 operated by a Hungarian airline, police said. The deboarded passengers and crew members were accommodated in hotels for the night.

264.title: Look at kind of films H'wood are bringing: Akshay on B'wood not doing well
264.article_body: Speaking about the poor performances of Bollywood films, actor Akshay Kumar has said, "Look at Hollywood, what kind of movies they are bringing." He added that people come together to watch Marvel films. "The audience wants a story and much more. They don't want to just give their money, they want value for it," he further added.

265.title: Conspiracy being hatched against Bengal, TMC getting defamed: Mamata
265.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said a conspiracy is being hatched against the state and the TMC is being defamed as a part of the exercise. "If a person has committed any mistake, one should be given a chance to rectify those mistakes. If someone got involved in any wrongdoing, the law will take its own course," CM Banerjee added.

266.title: HC rejects plea challenging parole to rape convict Gurmeet Ram Rahim
266.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court rejected a plea challenging the Dera Sacha Sauda chief and rape convict Gurmeet Ram Rahim's parole. The petition stated that by allowing Ram Rahim to hold 'satsang', the government is virtually bowing before a rape and murder convict and treating him in a manner as if he is above the law of the land.

267.title: Airplane bought by Hyd’s Pista House gets stuck at underpass; video surfaces
267.article_body: An old airplane that was bought by Hyderabad’s Pista House owner at a Kerala auction got stuck at an underpass in Andhra Pradesh's Bapatla district. It was being transported by road from Kochi to Hyderabad. Huge crowd reached the spot to have a glimpse of the plane. Police reached the spot and made an arrangement to pull out the plane.

268.title: Thought I'm being too toxic: Raj on 'Dear Comrade' scene where he hits Rashmika
268.article_body: Actor Raj Arjun, who played a negative role in Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's 'Dear Comrade', opened up about the film's scene where he had to hit Rashmika's character. "I'd sympathised with her during the shoot and I thought I'm being too toxic," Raj stated. Speaking about Rashmika, Raj said that the actress is "very humble" and a "lovely soul".

269.title: Aftab & Shraddha had eloped to Delhi as her family disapproved of relationship
269.article_body: Aftab Ameen Poonawalla, who allegedly killed his live-in partner Shraddha and chopped her body into 35 pieces in Delhi, had met Shraddha in Mumbai, police said. The two fell in love while working in Mumbai and had eloped to Delhi as her family disapproved of their relationship, they added. He allegedly killed her when she started pressuring him for marriage.

270.title: Big actors are coming on OTT as we need jobs: KGF 2's Prakash Raj
270.article_body: Actor Prakash Raj, who featured in films like 'KGF: Chapter 2' and 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', has said that big actors are coming on OTT platforms because they need jobs. "Today, big actors who are coming to OTT also have to realise that just because you are a big actor, posters might work but people are noticing content," he added.

271.title: Shardul Thakur, 2 other players traded to KKR ahead of IPL 2023
271.article_body: Bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur has been traded from Delhi Capitals (DC) to Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) ahead of IPL 2023. KKR have acquired Shardul in an all-cash deal. Shardul was bought by DC for ₹10.75 crore in the mega auction earlier this year. Further, Lockie Ferguson and Rahmanullah Gurbaz have been traded from Gujarat Titans (GT) to KKR.

272.title: 62-year-old woman tricked into giving her gold ornament in Pune
272.article_body: A 62-year-old woman on her way to buy vegetables was tricked, by two unidentified persons, into giving away her gold ornament in Pune's Onkar Colony area. They allegedly said they were gifting sarees to elderly women. They said she'll have to take off her gold mangalsutra and put it in a pouch. Later, they stole the pouch and escaped.

273.title: Ajay's Drishyam 2's advance booking surpasses Thank God & Runway 34
273.article_body: Ajay Devgn and Tabu-starrer 'Drishyam 2' has reportedly sold over 35,000 tickets at three national chains through advance booking. As per reports, the Abhishek Pathak directorial has sold more tickets through advance booking than Ajay's previous two films 'Runway 34' and 'Thank God'. 'Drishyam 2' is a crime-mystery film which is set to release on November 18.

274.title: Father jumps to save daughter who fell from train in UP, both die
274.article_body: A 32-year-old man and his three-year-old daughter died after she fell from a moving train and he jumped from it to save her in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi on Sunday. The father-daughter duo and other family members were sitting near the train's door as it was overcrowded and they could not get seats. The bodies were sent for post-mortem.

275.title: RPO Hyderabad issues advisory for passport, PCC applicants
275.article_body: Hyderabad's Regional Passport Office (RPO) issued an advisory for passport or police clearance certificate (PCC) applicants. The advisory mentions step by step process that applicants should follow while submitting application. Payment of required fee and scheduling an appointment are mandatory and applicants have to bring a printout or soft copy of online appointment receipt, the advisory stated.

276.title: Russia denies report claiming Lavrov was taken to hospital in Bali
276.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry on Monday denied a report claiming that Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov was rushed to the hospital after he arrived in Indonesia's Bali for the G20 summit. "This, of course, is the height of fakery," Foreign Ministry Spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said. Notably, Lavrov is representing Russian President Vladimir Putin at the summit.

277.title: Akhilesh's wife Dimple files nomination for Mainpuri Lok Sabha bypoll
277.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav filed her nomination for the Mainpuri Parliamentary by-election today. Akhilesh also accompanied her during the nomination process. Prior to filing nomination, both Akhilesh and Dimple Yadav paid tribute to Mulayam Singh Yadav at Saifai. Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri seat was left vacant following the demise of Mulayam Singh Yadav on October 10.

278.title: I know how it feels after such a loss: Inzamam on Pak's loss in T20 WC final
278.article_body: Reflecting on Pakistan's loss in T20 World Cup 2022 final, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he understands what the players must be going through. "It was a disappointing result. We had lost the 1999 World Cup final. I know how it feels after such a loss," he added. England beat Pakistan by five wickets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday.

279.title: I request Babar Azam to start working against googly: Shoaib Malik
279.article_body: During a discussion over Pakistan's performance against England in the 2022 T20 World Cup final, veteran Pakistan batter Shoaib Malik said he wants to request their captain Babar Azam to start working against googly. "This [dismissal against googly] has been happening quite often...he needs to work on that," stated Malik. England's Adil Rashid dismissed Babar in the final for 32(28).

280.title: Video shows Tesla car going out of control & crashing into vehicles killing 2 in China
280.article_body: A motorcyclist and a schoolgirl were killed when a Tesla car went out of control and crashed into several vehicles at full speed, reports said. CCTV footage has shown the Model Y flying through busy roads, injuring at least three people, after its driver encountered an issue while trying to park. Tesla said it'll help Chinese authorities investigate the incident.

281.title: Kohli might play in 2024 T20 WC, but I don't see Rohit playing: Monty Panesar
281.article_body: Former England player Monty Panesar has said senior Indian players Rohit Sharma, Dinesh Karthik, and Ravichandran Ashwin should retire from T20I cricket to make way for young players. "Age is just a number for Virat considering his super fitness. You may see him in the 2024 T20 World Cup...[but] I'm not seeing Rohit being part of that tournament," added Panesar.

282.title: Maha Minister must be thrown out for remark on Sule: Jaya Bachchan
282.article_body: SP MP Jaya Bachchan, women leaders from Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena and NCP, on Monday, met Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari over the alleged objectionable remarks by State Minister Abdul Sattar against NCP's Supriya Sule. "Any person, including politicians, who make objectionable comments against women should be thrown out to set an example," Bachchan said.

283.title: Man rips up road reportedly built for ₹3.8 crore with hands in UP; video surfaces
283.article_body: A video of a man ripping up a road, reportedly built for ₹3.8 crore, using his hands in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit has surfaced online. In the purported video, the man can be heard asking authorities to take action against the contractor. An assistant engineer at Rural Engineering Department said that administrative officials had got the road repaired, Times Now reported.

284.title: Sajid kept looking at my private parts, said I should use oil for breasts: Sheela Seth
284.article_body: Actress Sheela Priya Seth has accused filmmaker Sajid Khan of looking at her private parts for about five minutes straight in 2008. Sheela stated, "Sajid said I should get surgery done as my breasts aren't big enough for Bollywood. He even said I should use some oils to enlarge my breasts." "These remarks of Sajid Khan terrified me," Sheela said.

285.title: College girl dies after being raped in UP, 25-yr-old accused says he took 'energy pill'
285.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping a college student who died due to excessive bleeding in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao. Police said that accused confessed to the crime and claimed to have taken an energy enhancing pill before committing the crime. The victim's father alleged that a 28-year-old neighbour and a 65-year-old woman were involved in the incident.

286.title: Aftab bought fridge to store girlfriend Shraddha's body parts for days in Delhi: Police
286.article_body: After a man named Aftab Ameen was arrested for allegedly killing and chopping his 26-year-old live-in partner Shraddha into 35 pieces in Delhi, police said that he had bought a fridge to store her parts before disposing them. Aftab, who allegedly killed her on May 18, threw her body parts across the city over the next 18 days.

287.title: Earthquake of 6.1 magnitude hits Japan, tremors felt in Tokyo
287.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 6.1 was detected off central Japan on Monday and the tremors were felt in Tokyo and other cities. As per the USGS, the earthquake hit 84 km South Southeast of Toba in Japan around 1:38 pm UTC. It had a depth of 357 km, the agency added. No warning for a tsunami was issued immediately.

288.title: Rajkummar reveals he was supposed to be one of the leads in 'Gangs...'
288.article_body: Rajkummar Rao shared that when he was initially offered Anurag Kashyap's 'Gangs of Wasseypur', he was one of the leads in the film. "The film he (Anurag) narrated was Faisal Khan (Nawazuddin's role) vs Shamshad Alam (Rajkummar's role)," he revealed. Rajkummar added that after Anurag finished writing the film's script, he told him that his role "had become much shorter".

289.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal knew about Jal Board scam: BJP
289.article_body: The BJP demanded an FIR against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in the alleged ₹20 crore Delhi Jal Board scam and claimed that Kejriwal knew about the irregularities. "When Kejriwal got to know about this, he did not file an FIR...instead, he extended the contract with Corporation Bank for two more years and also increased their commission," said the BJP.

290.title: Illegal structures of accused in MLAs poaching case demolished in Hyd
290.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) on Sunday demolished two structures, which it deemed illegal, being taken up inside a restaurant in the city. The alleged illegal structures are linked to Nanda Kumar, who was earlier arrested in the TRS MLAs poaching case. A senior GHMC official claimed Kumar didn't pay attention to notices seeking to stop construction.

291.title: I will expose the reality of how Pakistan treated me, it will shock many: Adnan Sami
291.article_body: Singer Adnan Sami, who was a Pakistani citizen, said he has "major issues" with the Pakistan establishment. "One day...I'll expose the reality of how they treated me...which not many know...least of all the general public," he said, adding that it'll shock many. Adnan stated what the establishment did to him was one of the big reasons why he left Pakistan.

292.title: Player of T20 World Cup 2022 Sam Curran was commentator in T20 World Cup 2021
292.article_body: England all-rounder Sam Curran, who won Player of the Tournament award for taking 13 wickets in T20 World Cup 2022, worked as a commentator in T20 World Cup 2021 while recovering from a back injury. The 24-year-old had sustained the injury during IPL 2021. Curran was the only bowler to take a five-wicket haul in T20 World Cup 2022.

293.title: The maker of modern India: Kharge on Jawaharlal Nehru's birth anniversary
293.article_body: On the occasion of former PM Jawaharlal Nehru’s birth anniversary, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said his progressive thoughts furthered India’s social, political and economic development, despite challenges. “Pandit Nehru - the maker of modern India. The 21st century India cannot be imagined without his tremendous contribution,” Kharge tweeted. “My humble homage to a true patriot,” he added.

294.title: Will highlight our commitment towards global challenges: PM ahead of G20
294.article_body: Ahead of the G20 summit in Indonesia, PM Narendra Modi said that he will highlight India's achievements and unwavering commitment to collectively address global challenges. "India will officially assume the G20 Presidency from 1st December 2022. I will also extend my personal invitation to G20 members and other invitees to our G20 summit next year," said PM Modi.

295.title: Mahesh Babu's father Krishna suffers cardiac arrest, admitted in ICU in Hyderabad
295.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu's father Krishna was rushed to a hospital in Hyderabad last night in an unconscious state after suffering a cardiac arrest. As per a hospital report, he was revived after performing CPR and is currently in ICU, where he will be monitored for next 24 hours. Krishna's first wife and Mahesh Babu's mother Indira Devi died in September.

296.title: Adani replies to tweet on help for 4-yr-old with hole in heart, says 'she'll be fine soon'
296.article_body: Gautam Adani has replied to a tweet seeking help for a four-year-old girl named Manushree who has a hole in her heart. The post sought ₹1.25 lakh for her treatment. "Manushree will be fine very soon. Have asked [Adani Foundation] to...ensure that the family gets all possible help...to get Manushree back to school playing with her friends," Adani tweeted.

297.title: Faridabad Police launch night pick-and-drop facility for women
297.article_body: Faridabad Police have launched a free night pick-and-drop facility for women. The initiative was taken to ensure the safety of women and curb crimes against them at night, police said. "Any woman who is not able...to get back home between 10 pm and 6 am can call the police helpline numbers, [which are] 9999150000, 0129-2227200 and 7290010000," an official said.

298.title: If I were running Indian cricket, I'd look at England for inspiration: Vaughan
298.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said their current men's cricket team is a "trendsetting team" and the rest of the world should emulate them. "If I [were] running Indian cricket, I'd swallow my pride and look at England for inspiration," he added. England have become the first-ever team to hold both ODI and T20 World Cups at the same time.

299.title: Harry Styles does gender reveal for pregnant fan at concert, fans react
299.article_body: Singer-actor Harry Styles, at his Los Angeles concert, revealed the gender of a pregnant fan's baby. The video of the moment has gone viral on social media platforms and has been receiving reactions from fans. "I'm voting for Harry Styles for Artist of The Year at the AMAs," a fan wrote, while another fan called the moment "really cute".

300.title: Kandhal Jadeja who is NCP's only MLA in Gujarat resigns from party
300.article_body: The only MLA for NCP in Gujarat Assembly, Kandhal Jadeja, has resigned from the party ahead of upcoming state Assembly elections. State NCP chief Jayant Boskey said that Jadeja, who is a two-time MLA from Kutiyana, has cited being denied a ticket as a reason for the resignation. Jadeja had filed his nomination for the upcoming polls under NCP earlier.

301.title: Pune Police arrest domestic help for theft of valuables worth ₹22.80 lakh
301.article_body: The Pune Police arrested a 34-year-old domestic help for stealing valuables worth ₹22.80 lakh from the house of his employer. According to the police, the accused took the help of others to commit the crime because he wanted to open a paper plate manufacturing unit. The stolen valuables have been recovered from the accused.

302.title: Twitter fires 4,400 contractual employees: Report
302.article_body: Elon Musk-led Twitter laid off 4,400 of its nearly 5,500 contractual employees in the US, India and other markets, Platformer reported. The contractual workers were laid off with no notice and they began losing access to Slack and email. This comes after Twitter already sacked nearly 50% of its overall staff and close to 90% of its India team.

303.title: Govt seeks time to reply on pleas challenging Places Of Worship Act
303.article_body: The Centre has sought more time from SC to submit its response to petitions challenging the constitutional validity of the Places of Worship Act. SC asked the Centre to file a response by December 12. The Act prohibits the filing of a lawsuit to reclaim a place of worship or change its character from what existed on August 15, 1947.

304.title: My Facebook page has been hacked, trying to restore it: Karthi
304.article_body: Actor Karthi shared on Twitter that his Facebook page was hacked and his team is trying to restore it. "Hello guys, my Facebook page has been hacked. We are trying to restore it with FB team," he tweeted. The tweet also received reactions from his fans. On the work front, Karthi was seen in 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part I' and 'Sardar'.

305.title: Vir Das' Hyderabad show cancelled amid protests, 2nd show cancelled in a week
305.article_body: Comedian Vir Das' stand-up show scheduled on November 20 in Hyderabad has been cancelled amid protests by right-wing organisations, who accused him of making 'anti-India' comments. Das' event in Bengaluru was also cancelled last week after threats of protests by Hindu Janajagruti Samiti (HJS), a right-wing organisation. "Das should apologise for his statement made against India in US," HJS said.

306.title: Gurugram man cheated of ₹45 lakh by 'South Korean woman' in crypto scam
306.article_body: A Gurugram-based businessman was allegedly cheated of ₹45 lakh by a woman, who claimed to be from South Korea, on the pretext of trading in cryptocurrency, police said. The man came in contact with the woman on Telegram and invested over ₹45 lakh on cryptocurrency exchange platform on her advice. He was later unable to withdraw money from the platform.

307.title: Politician gets 50 yrs' jail for killing husband with kids' help in Brazil
307.article_body: Former Brazilian Congresswoman Flordelis dos Santos was sentenced to 50 years in prison for her husband Anderson do Carmo's murder in 2019. She was accused of planning the murder, involving several of her grown children in the crime and staging it as robbery. Prosecutors claimed she wanted control over the couple's finances. The couple had adopted several street children.

308.title: Babar was pretty ordinary vs England, a captain can't bat like that: Harbhajan
308.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has said Pakistan captain Babar Azam was pretty ordinary in his 32-run innings in the T20 World Cup final against England. "You're the captain of the ship and you cannot bat like that. You're putting your team in deep deep trouble," stated Harbhajan. England restricted Pakistan to 137/8 and chased down the target in 19 overs.

309.title: UFC star Anthony's 'Never been this afraid' note resurfaces after he dies aged 38
309.article_body: After two-time UFC title challenger Anthony 'Rumble' Johnson passed away aged 38, his old social media post on his illness has resurfaced online. In a note he posted last year, Anthony wrote, "Really wish I could go into detail about how ill I truly am...Never been this afraid of anything in my life."

310.title: Debina Bonnerjee shares video of premature daughter inside incubator, calls her 'miracle'
310.article_body: Actress Debina Bonnerjee on Sunday shared a video of her premature daughter inside an incubator being examined by doctors in a hospital on Instagram. Bonnerjee called her daughter a "miracle baby" and informed that she is doing fine, thanking the doctors. Bonnerjee and her husband actor Gurmeet Choudhary announced the birth of their second daughter on November 11.

311.title: Lingayat seer made minor sit on his lap, raped her several times: Police
311.article_body: Lingayat seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, who is accused of sexually assaulting minor girls, used to call one victim to his room at night. He raped her multiple times from 2013-2015, police's chargesheet claimed. "He would make me sit on his lap and touch my private parts inappropriately and then have sex with me," the victim said, according to the chargesheet.

312.title: Village head assaults Dalit man in presence of police in UP; held
312.article_body: A village head was arrested after he, his wife and associates allegedly assaulted a 25-year-old Dalit man in the presence of police personnel in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat. The man was assaulted while police were questioning him regarding a complaint that he was creating a nuisance and misbehaving with locals while under the influence of alcohol, the SHO said.

313.title: 'Yashoda' earns ₹20 cr worldwide, Samantha calls it 'best weekend ever'
313.article_body: The makers of 'Yashoda' shared that the film has earned ₹20 crore worldwide in its first weekend. Sharing the news on her Instagram Stories, actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu wrote that it has been the "best weekend ever". 'Yashoda', which released on November 11, marks Samantha's first film after she opened up about her myositis diagnosis.

314.title: Kerala HC cancels appointment of university VC whom Guv had asked to step down
314.article_body: Kerala High Court on Monday cancelled the appointment of Dr K Riji John as the Vice-Chancellor (VC) of the Kerala University of Fisheries and Ocean Studies. John is one of the VCs whom state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan had asked to step down in October. The court also ordered the formation of a search-cum-selection committee according to UGC norms.

315.title: Mumbai man gets bail after he assures court to care for minor girlfriend & baby
315.article_body: A 20-year-old Mumbai man, arrested for impregnating his minor girlfriend, was granted bail by a sessions court after he and his father assured the court that they will look after the minor and the newborn. A case was registered against the man, based on complaint filed by minor girl, who delivered a baby boy after her relationship with the accused.

316.title: Dalit man tied to pole, thrashed by upper-caste men in K'taka; 15 arrested
316.article_body: The Karnataka Police arrested 15 people for allegedly assaulting a Dalit man, Sagar, during an annual fair in Vijayapura district. According to the police, Sagar was drunk when a scuffle broke out after he questioned the upper-caste men for stopping the music during the festival. The men then tied him to a pole and thrashed him.

317.title: India's wholesale inflation dips to 8.39% in October, lowest since March 2021
317.article_body: India's wholesale inflation eased to 8.39% in October 2022 from 10.70% in September, data released by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry showed. The wholesale inflation index (WPI) has been in double digits for 18 consecutive months from April 2021 till September 2022. It stood at 7.89% in March 2021.

318.title: India reports 547 new COVID-19 cases, lowest since April 2020
318.article_body: India reported 547 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest since April 2020. The count of active cases has fallen below 10,000 for the first time since April 2020, at 9,468. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, the death toll in the country so far has reached 5,30,532.

319.title: I have too much work on my plate that is for sure: Elon Musk
319.article_body: Tesla, SpaceX and Twitter CEO Elon Musk at a business conference on the sidelines of the G20 summit said, "I have too much work on my plate that is for sure." Discussing his recent $44 billion acquisition of Twitter and heading Tesla, Musk said he was working "at the absolute most amount...from morning till night, seven days a week".

320.title: Man chops live-in partner into 35 parts, disposes them across Delhi for 18 days at 2am
320.article_body: A man has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly murdering his 26-year-old live-in partner and chopping her body into 35 pieces. Police said Aftab Ameen killed Shraddha on May 18 after she started forcing him for marriage. He allegedly left his home at 2am over the next 18 days to dispose of her body parts at different locations in Delhi.

321.title: 65-yr-old woman falls while 2 persons try to snatch her bag in Mumbai, dies
321.article_body: A 65-year-old homeless woman, sleeping on a cement platform in Mumbai, died after falling down three feet when two persons, including a 15-year-old boy, allegedly tried to snatch her bag in a robbery bid. The bag got stuck in her neck, throwing her off the platform. She was declared dead on arrival at a hospital due to head injuries.

322.title: Maha man who killed daughter, staged it as suicide was inspired by 'CID'
322.article_body: A man in Nagpur, Guddu Chhotelal Rajak, who allegedly killed his daughter and staged it as a suicide, was inspired by the crime series CID, police said. He wanted to teach his relatives and his wife a lesson after she refused to come back. A photograph showing the deceased with a noose around her neck was found on his phone.

323.title: Ranveer's '83' to screen in sign language, actor lends support
323.article_body: Director Kabir Khan's directorial '83' is set to screen in sign language. Sharing his reaction, Ranveer Singh said that he hopes the screening triggers more conversations related to making sign language the 23rd official language of India. "I've tried to do my bit...I'm always looking for opportunities to open up a conversation about the deaf people in India," he said.

324.title: UPSRTC introduces electronic ticketing to get real-time data
324.article_body: Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) is using android-based electronic ticketing machines to receive real-time data about its passengers and buses, according to a government spokesperson. UPSRTC Managing Director Sanjay Kumar said that the step, which allows the corporation to receive updated data of its buses, will be instrumental in providing services through digital means.

325.title: Varun Dhawan jumps off stage to help girl who fainted amid movie promotion in Jaipur
325.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan on Sunday jumped to the rescue of a girl who fainted during the promotional event of his upcoming film 'Bhediya' in Jaipur. A video of the incident has gone viral, in which Varun can be seen sitting by her side and making her drink water. Kriti Sanon is also seen asking the management to help the girl.

326.title: Punjab mandates use of paddy straw as 20% of fuel for brick kilns
326.article_body: The Punjab government on Sunday made it mandatory for brick kilns to use paddy straw as 20% of their fuel. The move will boost straw management and farmers will benefit financially by selling straw, state minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer said. He added that industries are being encouraged to use stubble as fuel for ex-situ stubble management.

327.title: Maha govt committed to resolving traffic woes in Thane: CM Eknath Shinde
327.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said his government is committed to resolving the traffic problems in Thane city. In order to eliminate traffic congestion in the city, various projects, including a bypass and extension of Eastern Freeway, have been undertaken, he added. The MMRDA and the Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) are working with this goal, he said.

328.title: HMDA announces draw of lots for Rajiv Swagruha flats on Tuesday
328.article_body: The draw of lots for sale of Rajiv Swagruha flats will be done on November 15 for applicants who have paid the advance amounts, Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) announced. The draw for allotment of flats will be conducted at Bandlaguda between 9:00 am to 1:00 pm and between 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm in Pocharam.

329.title: Jitendra Awhad booked for outraging BJP leader's modesty, to resign as MLA
329.article_body: NCP leader Dr Jitendra Awhad has been booked for outraging the modesty of a BJP woman leader and has said that he will resign as an MLA. The leader alleged Awahad pushed her on November 13 during a public event. Meanwhile, Awhad claimed police filed two false cases against him. "I will fight against this police brutality," he added.

330.title: Pavement that generates electricity when people walk on it installed in UK; pic released
330.article_body: A new pavement has been unveiled in the UK's Telford that generates electricity when you walk or run on it. Electricity produced from pedestrians or runners using the bouncy section powers mobile phone chargers built into a nearby bench. The pavement has been supplied by technology firm, Pavegen that has launched similar projects in Milan, Hong Kong and Dubai.

331.title: 500 postmen to get e-bikes soon for speedy mail delivery in Pune
331.article_body: At least 500 postmen in Pune will very soon get e-bikes from the government so that they can reach out to citizens conveniently and as soon as possible, without getting tired. Pune region's Postmaster General said, "Currently, e-bikes are being used in [Bengaluru]...The parcel delivery staff has a very good experience of using these bikes."

332.title: Taylor Swift leads MTV EMAs 2022 winner list, bags four awards
332.article_body: Singer Taylor Swift led MTV EMAs 2022 winner list with four awards. The singer won Best Artist, Best Video, Best Pop and Best Longform Video titles at the award ceremony. While accepting her first award for the night, Taylor credited her fans for the win and said that they "are the only reason any of this" happens to her.

333.title: Collegium system for appointment of judges can be improved: Ex-CJI
333.article_body: Former Chief Justice of India TS Thakur said the collegium system for appointment of judges to the higher judiciary can be improved and criticising it without coming up with an alternative “does not lead us anywhere". "Nobody can say that the collegium system for the appointment of judges is the most perfect system," he added.

334.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru on his birth anniversary
334.article_body: On the occasion of former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru's birth anniversary, PM Narendra Modi paid homage to him and recalled his contribution to the country. PM Modi tweeted, "On his birth anniversary, tributes to our former PM Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru...We also recall his contribution to our nation." Nehru was born in 1889 and is the longest serving Indian PM.

335.title: BMC planning to allow autos, bikes on one lane of Gokhale bridge: Reports
335.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is exploring possibilities of opening one lane of the now-closed Gokhale bridge for pedestrians, bikes and autos amid complaints of traffic congestion, said reports. The authorities have conducted structural analysis of the bridge and decision of opening one lane after giving additional support to the structure will be made this week, the reports added.

336.title: Jos Buttler has now created his own legacy: Stokes after winning T20 WC
336.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes praised his captain Jos Buttler after winning the 2022 T20 World Cup title, stating that the 32-year-old has now created his own legacy. "You look at how quickly Jos has managed to take control of the team and progress it from the legacy Eoin Morgan left," stated Stokes. "Buttler's decision-making has been absolutely right," he added.

337.title: ED arrests Vijay Nair in Delhi liquor policy case ahead of bail hearing
337.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested businessman Vijay Nair in the Delhi liquor policy case ahead of his bail hearing today. Nair is the former CEO of event management firm Only Much Louder and the reported aide of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. Nair was arrested along with businessman Abhishek Boinpally, who allegedly lobbied for certain South India-based businessmen.

338.title: Cristiano Ronaldo claims he is being forced out of Manchester United
338.article_body: Five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo has claimed he is being forced out of Manchester United. During an interview with Piers Morgan, Ronaldo stated that manager Erik ten Hag and two or three senior executives at Manchester United have "betrayed" him and they want him out of the club. Ronaldo has started in just four Premier League matches this season.

339.title: Kolkata's Shlok is the winner of Doodle For Google 2022 India, gets ₹5 lakh scholarship
339.article_body: The winner of the 2022 Doodle for Google competition in India is Shlok Mukherjee from Kolkata, West Bengal. Mukherjee won for his Doodle titled 'India on the Center Stage', featured on Google.co.in today. Google said it is honoured to award Shlok with ₹5 lakh college scholarship and ₹2 lakh technology package for his school.

340.title: Iran issues 1st death sentence to detainee linked to anti-hijab protests
340.article_body: Iran on Sunday issued its first death sentence to a detainee linked to the anti-hijab protests. The detainee was sentenced to death for the crime of "setting fire to a government building, disturbing public order, assembly and conspiracy to commit a crime against national security, and an enemy of God and corruption on earth", the judiciary's Mizan Online website said.

341.title: Ravindra Jadeja urges people to vote for his wife Rivaba in Gujarat polls
341.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, cricketer Ravindra Jadeja urged the people of Jamnagar to vote for his wife, Rivaba Jadeja, who has been fielded by the BJP. "The Gujarat election is here and it's like a T20 match. My wife is making her grand debut in politics on a BJP ticket," said Jadeja. Rivaba replaced sitting MLA Dharmendrasinh Jadeja.

342.title: Will not be performing at 2022 FIFA World Cup, confirms Dua Lipa
342.article_body: Singer Dua Lipa has confirmed that she will not be performing at the opening ceremony of 2022 FIFA World Cup, which is to be held in Qatar. "I look forward to visiting Qatar when it has fulfilled all the human rights pledges it made when it won the right to host the World Cup," she wrote on her Instagram Stories.

343.title: 5 students arrested for assaulting junior in Hyderabad
343.article_body: Five students of a Hyderabad-based institute have been arrested and a search operation has been launched for seven others for allegedly assaulting an undergraduate student in a hostel room, police said. A video of the assault had gone viral earlier. Police claimed the assault happened after a rift between the victim and his ex-girlfriend. Notably, the accused students were suspended.

344.title: Turning point was Shaheen's injury: Akhtar on Pak losing T20 WC 2022 final
344.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said that the "turning point" in the Pakistan-England 2022 T20 World Cup final was Shaheen Afridi's injury. "It's fine...we will win the World Cup in India now," added Shoaib. Shaheen sustained the injury in the 13th over of England's run-chase and went off the field after bowling the first delivery of the 16th over.

345.title: Godrej purchases 2 group housing plots in Noida for ₹377 crore in e-bidding
345.article_body: The Godrej Properties Limited bought two group housing plots in Noida Sector 146 for ₹377 crore, in an e-auction on Friday, Noida authority officials said. The reserve price for a single plot in this scheme is ₹188 crore and Godrej placed the highest bid, the officials added. DLF and Golf Green Mansions were the other eligible developers for e-bidding.

346.title: Crypto industry has a role to protect consumers: Binance CEO
346.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao told a gathering of G20 leaders in Bali, "I think the [crypto] industry collectively has a role to protect consumers, to protect everybody...Regulators have a role but it's not 100% their responsibility." "We do need some regulations, we do need to do this properly, we do need to do this in a stable way," he added.

347.title: Earthquake of 4.1 magnitude hits Punjab's Amritsar
347.article_body: The National Center for Seismology confirmed that an earthquake of magnitude 4.1 occurred near Punjab's Amritsar early on Monday morning. It happened at a depth of 120 kilometres, 145 kilometres west-northwest of Amritsar, with latitude of 31.95 degrees and longitude of 73.38 degrees. Earlier on Saturday, Delhi-NCR and some other northern states witnessed earthquake tremors.

348.title: Elon Musk apologises for Twitter being 'super slow', announces new feature
348.article_body: Twitter's new CEO Elon Musk apologised for the micro-blogging platform being "super slow" in many countries. "App is doing >1000 poorly batched RPCs just to render a home timeline," he stated. He also announced that Twitter will role out a new feature soon that will enable organisations to identify which other Twitter accounts are associated with them.

349.title: 2-yr-old girl playing with brothers dies as tempo crushes her in Mumbai
349.article_body: A two-year-old girl died after she was crushed under the wheels of a tempo in a locality in Mumbai, police said on Sunday. The girl was playing with her brothers on a road when the tempo driver did not notice her and the vehicle crushed her. The driver did not stop the vehicle after it hit the girl and escaped.

350.title: Fatima reveals she has epilepsy, says 'was diagnosed during Dangal, woke up at hospital'
350.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh took to Instagram to spread awareness about epilepsy, a disorder in which nerve cell activity in the brain is disturbed, causing seizures and revealed that she has been living with the disorder. She said she was diagnosed when she was training for 'Dangal' movie, adding, "I got an episode and woke up straight at the hospital."

351.title: I feel betrayed by Manchester United, I don't have respect for Erik ten Hag: Ronaldo
