351.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has said that he feels betrayed by Manchester United, claiming that manager Erik ten Hag tried to force him out of the club in the summer. "I don't have respect for him because he doesn't show respect for me," Ronaldo said. "I feel...some people didn't want me here, not only this year but last season too," he added.

352.title: Xi Jinping to arrive in Bali for meeting with Joe Biden
352.article_body: China's President Xi Jinping will arrive in Indonesia's Bali on Monday for a meeting with US President Joe Biden ahead of the G20 summit. The leaders have held five phone or video calls since Biden became US President in January 2021. Xi and Biden are expected to discuss Taiwan and Russia's invasion of Ukraine among other topics.

353.title: England players wait for Moeen, Adil Rashid to step aside before champagne celebration
353.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing England players waiting for Moeen Ali and Adil Rashid to step aside before champagne celebration following their win in the T20 World Cup 2022 final against Pakistan on Sunday.  Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "Nice gesture by Jos Buttler." "Sort of great sportsmanship," wrote another.

354.title: Students clash over England-Pak T20 WC final at college in Punjab
354.article_body: Some students suffered minor injuries after a clash broke out between students from Bihar and Jammu and Kashmir at a college in Punjab's Moga after T20 World Cup final between England and Pakistan on Sunday. An argument broke out between the students who were watching the match together, police said. Students threw stones at each other, police added.

355.title: Tesla to assist police probing Model Y crash that killed 2 in China
355.article_body: Tesla will assist Chinese police probing the crash of a Model Y car that killed two people and left three injured in Guangdong. A video of the incident showed a Tesla Model Y swerving between lanes at high speed, sideswiping cars and motorcycles before eventually crashing into a storefront. A motorcyclist and a schoolgirl died in the accident.

356.title: Khushi is made for big screen, she's a natural: Janhvi Kapoor
356.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor said that her sister Khushi Kapoor "has been made for the big screen" because of "how natural she is". Janhvi guarantees that there'll be "no pretence in her work" as she's "incapable of being fake". "That is an important aspect of being an actress because every time she acts, it comes from a place of truth," Janhvi added.

357.title: Don’t just flag problems, resolve them: Shah to Intelligence Bureau
357.article_body: The Intelligence Bureau (IB) shouldn't limit itself to preparing reports but get actively involved in resolving internal security issues, from inter-state disputes to radicalisation and terrorism, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said. "He emphasised...IB isn’t just supposed to flag problems...it must get actively involved with issues and try to resolve them," a Home Ministry official said.

358.title: Twitter spends ₹104 crore/year on food service at headquarters in San Francisco: Musk
358.article_body: Elon Musk said that Twitter spent $13 million (around ₹104 crore) per year on food services at its San Francisco headquarters. He said this while dismissing Twitter's former Vice President of Work Transformation Tracy Hawkins' claim that the company spent $20-$25 a day per person. "There are more people preparing breakfast than eating breakfast," Musk added.

359.title: Udaipur track repaired after explosion caused cracks: Railways
359.article_body: After an explosion caused cracks on a railway track in Rajasthan's Udaipur, the track was repaired, Indian Railways informed on Monday. The repair work was completed at 3:30 am and as a precautionary measure, a trial run of a railway engine was done, it added. The explosion occurred hours before the Asarwa-Udaipur Express train was supposed to pass.

360.title: Wouldn't enter Bigg Boss as contestant now, it's brutal: Sunny Leone
360.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone said she's "probably not" open to entering 'Bigg Boss' again as a contestant as, in her opinion, the show has become "brutal". "When I was on the show, it was still a little tame...I don't think I would last, I would just fall apart," she added. Sunny made her Indian television debut with 'Bigg Boss 5'.

361.title: CM Mamata should take action: Assam CM on WB minister's comment on Prez Murmu
361.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma reacted to West Bengal minister Akhil Giri's comment on President Droupadi Murmu, saying CM Mamata Banerjee should take action against him. "Everybody thinks he made the statement deliberately," Sarma added. "Tribal people in Assam filed a complaint against him but it's the responsibility of the CM to take a tough call," he stated.

362.title: Twitter lays off 4,400 contract workers without notice: Report
362.article_body: Twitter fired 4,400 of its 5,500 contract workers this weekend without notice, both in the US and abroad, according to Platformer. Full-time employees said they were not given an internal notice before contractors they were collaborating with were let go. Many contractors found out they had been fired after they abruptly lost access to Twitter's internal systems.

363.title: IMD predicts light rain, below-average temp for Bengaluru today
363.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted light rain for Bengaluru today and said that the temperature will remain below-average (between 19 and 26 degree Celsius) in the city. "Generally cloudy sky. Light rain/thundershowers are very likely. Mist is very likely during early morning hours in some areas," the weather department said. The atmospheric humidity will be around 94%, it added.

364.title: Assam CM asks officials to help elderly woman involved in land dispute, shares video
364.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has shared a video of his interaction with an elderly woman involved in a land dispute in Kokrajhar. In the video, Sarma can be seen directing the district's DC and SP to resolve the land dispute and make arrangements for the woman to build a house. He tweeted, "God's grace to be able to serve!"

365.title: Team of T20 World Cup 2022 announced by ICC, 2 Indians included
365.article_body: ICC today announced Team of T20 World Cup 2022, which includes four England players and two players each from India and Pakistan. Tournament-winning England skipper Jos Buttler has been named opener, captain and wicketkeeper of the team. Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav have been included as number three and number four batters, respectively. Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza has also been included.

366.title: Suspect arrested in Istanbul explosion that left 6 dead, 81 injured
366.article_body: The person responsible for bomb attack in Istanbul on Sunday has been arrested by the police, said Turkey's Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu. The bomb explosion had left six people dead and wounded around 81 people. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan called the explosion something that "smells like terrorism" and added that its perpetrators would be punished.

367.title: UFC star Anthony 'Rumble' Johnson dies aged 38
367.article_body: Two-time UFC title challenger Anthony 'Rumble' Johnson passed away aged 38 on Sunday. "Johnson had been battling an illness for quite some time," his manager Ali Abdelaziz said. Johnson was due to fight for the Bellator light-heavyweight title in September of last year, but pulled out due to a health issue that persisted over the past year.

368.title: SoftBank stock falls 12% in its biggest intraday drop since early 2020
368.article_body: The shares of SoftBank fell 12% on Monday in the biggest intraday drop since the outbreak of COVID-19 in early 2020. The fall followed SoftBank's reporting of investment losses at its Vision Fund unit of over $9 billion in the July-September quarter. However, SoftBank reported a net profit of over $21 billion, marking the first net profit in three quarters.

369.title: Black and yellow taxis in Mumbai to have roof top indicators soon
369.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Transport Authority (MMRTA) has made it mandatory for all black and yellow taxis in the city to install the colour-coded indicator by March 31, 2023. The LED indicator will have green, red and white-coloured lights which can tell if the taxi is vacant, hired, or the driver wants to take a break.

370.title: 8-yr-old brain dead girl's family donates her liver, kidneys in Delhi
370.article_body: The family of an eight-year-old brain dead girl, who had fallen down from a certain height in UP's Mathura, has donated her liver, kidneys, corneas and heart valves in Delhi's AIIMS. Mansi's liver and a kidney were transplanted in a five-year-old while her other kidney was given to a 12-year-old child. Her corneas and heart valves have been preserved.

371.title: CAIT to launch e-commerce portal Bharat eMart soon
371.article_body: Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said that its e-commerce platform Bharat eMart will be launched soon across the country. The portal, first announced in May 2020, will allow traders to set up their e-shops and is expected to compete with platforms such as Flipkart and Amazon. Traders will be taught about data management and usage of AI, CAIT said.

372.title: NCPCR orders probe into religious conversion of 3 kids at childcare centre in MP
372.article_body: NCPCR chief Priyank Kanoongo said the child rights body has taken cognisance of religious conversion of three kids at a state-run childcare centre in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen. He urged local administration to file a lawsuit against the centre's management, which also created paperwork with the kids' new identities and faith. "Religious conversion of kids is a serious matter," Kanoongo tweeted.

373.title: Didn't find material good enough to sustain conviction: Ex-CJI on Chhawla case verdict
373.article_body: Former CJI UU Lalit on Sunday said that the three accused in the Chhawla rape case were awarded the death penalty on the basis of circumstantial evidence. "We didn't find material good enough to sustain...conviction," he told Times Now. He separately told ANI that "unless and until guilt is completely established, circumstantial evidence theory is not to be accepted".

374.title: Who were the highest wicket-takers in T20 World Cup 2022?
374.article_body: Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga was the highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup 2022 with 15 scalps. This is the second straight T20 World Cup in which Hasaranga has finished as the highest wicket-taker. Player of the Tournament Sam Curran of England and Netherlands' Bas de Leede took 13 wickets each. Zimbabwe's Blessing Muzarabani took 12 wickets in the tournament.

375.title: Competition law amendments to provide business certainty: Govt
375.article_body: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) said that revised timelines proposed in the competition law  amendments will help in providing certainty to businesses. With the Competition Act amendment bill being examined, one proposal is to reduce time limits of mergers and acquisitions to 150 days from 210 days currently. The MCA said that this will make the process time-bound.

376.title: I don't see Rohit Sharma playing in the next T20 WC: Wasim Jaffer
376.article_body: Ex-cricketer Wasim Jaffer said that he doesn't see Indian skipper Rohit Sharma playing in the 2024 T20 World Cup. "I think Rohit is that name for me...Having too many names on the pool sometimes confuses you and that is exactly what happened to the Indian team in the tournament," Jaffer said. Rohit made 116 runs in the 2022 T20 WC.

377.title: He is a champion under pressure: Ex-NZ skipper Fleming on Stokes
377.article_body: Ex-New Zealand skipper Stephen Fleming said that English all-rounder Ben Stokes is a champion under pressure. "Stokes is a big presence...he is a big personality and a big winner. Those are the key ingredients that you need from being a good to a great player," Fleming said. Stokes made 52*(49) against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup final on Sunday.

378.title: Bihar Congress to start extension of Bharat Jodo Yatra on Dec 28
378.article_body: The Bihar Pradesh Congress Committee (BPCC) will start an extension of the Bharat Jodo Yatra in the state from December 28, All India Congress Committee General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said. The Yatra will be undertaken from Banka to Bodh Gaya and will cover 1,200 km and 17 districts, including Patna. A similar yatra will also be undertaken in West Bengal.

379.title: Who were the highest run-scorers in T20 World Cup 2022?
379.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli top-scored in T20 World Cup 2022 with 296 runs. With this, he became the first-ever batter to finish as highest run-getter in two editions of T20 World Cup. Kohli was the top run-getter in 2014 edition with 319 runs. Netherlands' Max O'Dowd and India's Suryakumar Yadav finished as the second-highest and third-highest run-getters in 2022 edition.

380.title: Telugu producers urge theatres to give preference to straight films during festivals
380.article_body: Telugu Film Producers Council stated theatres should give preference to non-dubbed Telugu films during festivals like Dussehra and Sankranti. The council, in a press release, referred to a resolution it passed in 2019 during an emergency meeting. "Telugu Film Producers Council requests the exhibitors to invariably implement this decision," the statement further read.

381.title: You're a nobody: Harsh to Twitter user who told him to 'stick to acting'
381.article_body: Actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor has reacted to a Twitter user after the latter told him to "stick to acting" over the actor's tweet over the football club Chelsea. "There's a reason why you never succeeded as an actor. You should stick to acting," the user had written. Harsh replied, "You're a nobody on Twitter that no one will...care about."

382.title: Third round of India-EU trade pact talks to start from November-end: Report
382.article_body: A delegation from the European Union (EU) is reportedly set to visit India on November 28 for the third round of talks for the India-EU Trade and Investment Agreement, including the Geographical Indications. According to the commerce ministry, the trade agreement with the EU would help India to further expand and diversify its exports of goods and services.

383.title: Pakistani fan recreates 2019 World Cup's viral angry reaction, ICC shares video
383.article_body: A Pakistani fan recreated the 2019 World Cup's viral angry reaction during Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 final defeat against England. The ICC shared a video of reaction of both the fans and wrote, "Thought this looked familiar!"  Notably, Pakistani cricket fan Sarim Akhtar had gone viral for staring angrily at Asif Ali after dropped catch during 2019 World Cup.

384.title: At least 6 dead in Istanbul blast, Turkey President says 'There is a smell of terror'
384.article_body: At least six people were killed and several others injured in a blast on a pedestrian street in Istanbul on Sunday. "It might be wrong if we say for sure...this is terror [attack] but according to first signs...there's a smell of terror there," Turkey President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan said. "Relevant units of our state are working to find...perpetrators," he added.

385.title: Met my husband through Ajay Devgn: 'Drishyam 2' actress Ishita Dutta
385.article_body: Actress Ishita Dutta, who'll next be seen in 'Drishyam 2', spoke about her co-star Ajay Devgn and revealed that because of him, she and her actor-husband Vatsal Sheth met and got married. "I met my husband through Ajay sir. I'm very happy that he was our matchmaker," she said. Vatsal is known for starring in 'Taarzan: The Wonder Car'.

386.title: Loved my time in IPL, learnt a lot: Curran after winning T20 WC
386.article_body: After being named the 'Player of the Tournament' and 'Man of the Match' in the T20 World Cup final on Sunday, English seamer Sam Curran said that he learnt a lot during his IPL stint. "I loved my time there (IPL)... It is fantastic learning from guys who have played in these tournaments and big occasions," Curran said.

387.title: Southeast Asia shouldn't become proxy to other powers: Indonesia
387.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo on Sunday said that Southeast Asian countries should avoid becoming proxies to "any powers" and allowing "the current geopolitical dynamic" to turn into a "Cold War" in the region. Widodo's remarks came as Indonesia assumed ASEAN's chairmanship. Notably, there has been a recent rise in tensions between the US and China over Taiwan in the Asia-Pacific.

388.title: Ajay Devgn's 'Drishyam 2' gets U/A certificate, runtime to be 2 hrs 22 mins
388.article_body: Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has cleared Ajay Devgn and Tabu-starrer 'Drishyam 2' with U/A certificate. The film is expected to have a duration of 2 hours and 22 minutes. According to reports, the film has been passed with zero cuts. Directed by Abhishek Pathak, 'Drishyam 2' is set to release in theatres on November 18.

389.title: The improvement that Sam Curran has done is brilliant: Ian Bishop
389.article_body: Ex-West Indian pacer Ian Bishop said that the improvement that English seamer Sam Curran has made for the T20 World Cup in Australia is "brilliant". "It's not easy to be bowling across all the phases. If you think about...bowling in Australia, you think about really fast...[and] tall bowlers. Curran is among the shortest in this tournament," Bishop said.

390.title: Journalist beaten up with stick at Assam hospital; home guard suspended
390.article_body: A journalist was allegedly beaten up with a stick by a home guard when he had gone to deliver food for a relative admitted to a hospital in Assam's Cachar district on Saturday night. The home guard has been suspended, police said. Doctors have found five severe injuries on the journalist's body.

391.title: Robbers dismantle, steal ATM machine that had ₹10 lakh in Udaipur
391.article_body: A total of 5-6 people dismantled and took an ATM machine away in Rajasthan's Udaipur district, police said on Sunday. According to the bank to which the ATM belonged, the machine had ₹10 lakh in cash. The incident occurred on Saturday night when the accused held the ATM's guard hostage and took the ATM away in a vehicle, police said.

392.title: Tom Holland signs new deal for another 'Spider-Man' trilogy: Reports
392.article_body: Actor Tom Holland has reportedly signed a new deal for another 'Spider-Man' trilogy. It will be developed at Sony Pictures in partnership with Disney and Kevin Feige's Marvel Studios, as per reports. Tom has reportedly "closed a deal" for the yet-to-be-titled 'Spider-Man 4', the follow-up to 2021 film 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.

393.title: Odisha man removes cobra's fangs with nail cutter, arrested after video surfaces
393.article_body: A man from Odisha has been arrested after a video purportedly showing him extracting the fangs of a king cobra with the help of a nail cutter surfaced online. According to the state Forest Department, the cobra has been rescued from Bileisarda. A case has been registered and further investigation into the incident is underway.

394.title: Rahul beats drum with artists at Maha cultural show, video surfaces
394.article_body: During the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was seen beating a drum with artists at a cultural show in Kalamnuri, Hingoli district in Maharashtra. In a video, which has surfaced online, Gandhi can be seen hugging and shaking hands with the artists. The foot march commenced on September 7 from Kanyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

395.title: RRR opening scene took 35 days to shoot, Akshay does 1 film in 40 days: Charan
395.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said that his opening scene in SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' took 35 days to shoot. "Akshay Kumar sir finished a movie in 40 days or so I heard," he added. "I have had a dust allergy since childhood...I had even undergone sinus surgery. Look at my fate, I had to work in dust for 35 days," Ram stated.

396.title: NIA reaches Udaipur railway track site where explosion caused cracks
396.article_body: Those involved in the explosion on a newly opened railway line between Udaipur and Ahmedabad will be severely punished, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Sunday. He said the NIA along with other investigating agencies was at the site. The explosion occurred hours before the recently inaugurated Asarwa-Udaipur Express train from Ahmedabad was supposed to pass on the route.

397.title: Abhishek, Jaya, Shabana attend director Rakesh Kumar's prayer meet
397.article_body: A prayer meeting was held for late actor-filmmaker Rakesh Kumar on Sunday in Mumbai. Abhishek Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan and Shabana Azmi, among other Bollywood celebrities, paid their last respects to the director. Rakesh Kumar passed away on November 10 in Mumbai after a battle with cancer. He was best known for films like 'Mr Natwarlal', 'Khoon Pasina' and 'Yaarana'.

398.title: Only Pakistan could've stretched England this far: Chopra
398.article_body: After Pakistan lost to England in the T20 World Cup final after the former posted a total of 137 runs, ex-Indian batter Aakash Chopra said that Pakistan's bowling "made a match of it". "To be honest, only Pakistan could've stretched England this far. Outstanding bowling unit," Chopra said. England won the match by five wickets with an over to spare.

399.title: 2 children hit by UP Police vehicle on busy street, probe ordered
399.article_body: Two children were hit by a vehicle belonging to the Uttar Pradesh Police on a busy street in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat district on Saturday. The children were immediately rushed to a nearby hospital, where they received first-aid treatment. According to a senior officer, a probe has been ordered into the incident and a report has been sought within 24 hours.

400.title: FTX logo dropped out of ICC T20 World Cup Final after bankruptcy
400.article_body: The logo of FTX was taken down from the post-match presentation background stands that sport the sponsors' logos, dugouts and boundary triangles in the ICC T20 World Cup final on Sunday. The cryptocurrency exchange declared bankruptcy on Friday. The logos were visible during the semifinal that took place on Thursday and the matches that were played earlier.

401.title: List shows batters who smashed most sixes in T20 World Cup 2022
401.article_body: Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza smashed the most number of sixes (11) in T20 World Cup 2022. He is followed by England opener Alex Hales and Sri Lanka opener Kusal Mendis, who slammed 10 sixes each. Four batters, including India's Suryakumar Yadav, slammed nine sixes each, while five batters, including Virat Kohli and KL Rahul, slammed eight sixes each.
